text.value: Does the woman agree to receive counseling from you?
Do you want to receive this counselling with your husband?
Is your husband at home now?
Last BCS session you picked this method:

"Would you like to talk about family planning today? There are many effective methods that might work well for you to prevent or delay pregnancy. It is very important for the health of both a woman and her baby to delay pregnancy for at least 2 years after giving birth. And, if you have fulfilled desire to have babies , being on contraception helps you to prevent unwanted pregnancies. Women use family planning methods for many reasons. Some contraceptive methods also have additional benefits such as making your monthly bleeds less heavy.
If you are interested, I have different cards and contraception samples, which I can show you and discuss. First, I will ask you a few questions to help you decide which family planning methods might work best for you. I will discuss the methods that are available, the benefits, some of the possible side effects, and how you can access the methods. This is called balanced counselling and the counselling can help you to make decision on starting on a new contraception or change your current contraception. This will only take 5-10 minutes."

**Counseling**
We have many effective methods that might work well for you to prevent or delay pregnancy. It is very important for the health of you and your baby that you delay another pregnancy for at least 2 years after giving birth. Some contraceptive methods also have additional benefits such as making your monthly bleeds less heavy

Lactational amenorrhea method or LAM will only be effective for family planning until your baby is 6 months old. It will very be important to start another method at 6 months after your delivery. We have many other methods that are effective. It is important to start thinking and planning for other methods.
This women was provided balanced counselling on
Invite the husband and provide counselling to the couple together

"Ask: Do you have any questions about your current family planning methods?
Counseling Say: Condoms are important for all women and can be used along with other family planning methods. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning. Emergency contraception can be used after you have had sex without a condom or if the condom breaks. It is most effective if taken within 72 hours but may be effective for up to 5 days. You can get emergency contraception at the health post"
Are you breastfeeding a baby less than 6 months old?
Are you exclusively breastfeeding your baby?
Do you want to have children in the future?
Do you have have high blood pressure?
Do you have any other medical problems?
If you have had a baby recently have your monthly periods returned?
Any traditional method ( Withdrawal/ Rhythm/ Calendar)
Did the woman choose a family planning method?
Would like to consider options further
Would like to discuss with her partner
Needs additional referral or CHN visit
Concerned about side effects or health effects of contraception
Are there any methods that you do not want to use or did not like in the past?
Does your partner support you in family planning?
Misconceptions, misinformation, or lack of knowledge about family planning (think family planning is harmful to health, will cause future sterility, etc.)
Why does your husband not support you in family planning?
Is the woman 35 years or older and a smoker?

"Thank the woman for her time today. Say: In order to help you choose a family planning method, I will be using these cards.
INSTRUCTION: Display all cards in this order and briefly introduce each method:
1. Female sterilization 2. Vasectomy 3. Implant 4. IUCD 5. LAM 6. Injectable/Depo 7. Pills 8. Male Condom
Set Emergency Contraception card aside."
Set aside card for LAM. Say: You are not an under 6 month postpartum mother as a result you cannot use this method for family planning.
"Set aside tubal ligation (Female Sterilization) and Vasectomy cards. Say: These methods are permanent so you would not be able to have children in the future."
Set aside card for pills. Say: The hormones in these pills may affect breastfeeding.
Set aside card for LAM. Say: Since you are not breastfeeding you cannot use this method for family planning.
Set aside card for LAM. Say: This method requires that you are exclusively breastfeeding your baby.
"Set aside card for LAM. Say: This method requires that you do not have your monthly periods."
"Set aside card for Condoms and Vasectomy. Say: These methods require your partner to be supportive."

"Counsel: Condoms are important for all women but it can be difficult if your husband is not supportive. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmitted infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning."
"Set aside card for Pills. Say: Pills are not recommended for women with hypertension."
Set aside card for pills. Explain that pills are not recommended for women who smoke and are older than 35 years old. Smoking can have harmful health effects.

"Recommend referral to health facilty for additional counseling or request for CHN home visit.
Counseling: Condoms are important for all women. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. They can be used along with other methods of family planning.Discuss patient with CHN at next 1:1."
Set aside cards for methods woman does not want to use.

"1. Arrange the remaining cards from most effective to least effective method 2. Review the methods on the cards. 3. Ask woman if she would like to choose a method 4. Review chosen method in detail. Make sure no contraindications 5. Review information on method including side effects and where woman can access method."

Counsel on condoms and emergency contraception. Condoms are important for all women. Condoms when used consistently and correctly are important both for family planning and to prevent HIV/sexually transmissed infections. Emergency contraception can be used after you had had sex without a condom. It is most effective if taken within 72 hours but may be effective for up to 5 days. You can get emergency contraception at the health post
Say: If you change your mind you can go to the health post for counseling and family planning options.
Make plan and referral for woman to access method or to continue method.
This woman has had Sterilization or Mini-Lap. Sterilization does not protect against HIV. Condoms should still be used to prevent against HIV/sexually transmitted infections.
This woman has had Hysterectomy. Say: Hysterectomy does not protect against HIV. Condoms should still be used to prevent against HIV/sexually transmitted infections.
How long would you like to wait from now before the birth of a/another child?
What side effects are you concerned about?
Did the condom ever break during sex?
Was a condom used every time you had sex?
Counseling: This is a less effective method for family planning. It needs to be used consistently and condoms can break. We have many other methods that are more effective.

Last month you were using:
Did you discontinue the family planning method you were using last month?
Any traditional method? ( rhythm method/ calendar / withdrawal)
Are you currently doing something or using any method to delay or avoid getting pregnant?

* Days since her last depo shot :
* Her next depo date is:
Have you had a depo shot in the past 3 months?
Depo is effective for family planning if you get an injection every 3 months. You should go to the health post for your next injection as soon as possible.
Counseling Say: This method is used for emergency situations, but not recommended for routine use. We have many other effective methods that are more long term that emergency contraception.
Counseling Say: This is a less effective method for family planning. It needs to be used consistently and condoms can break. We have many other methods that are more effective.
It has been more than 5 years since you had the implant, did you go to any Health facility to change or remove Implant before this visit?
Will put implant in next visit
Have you had a new implant in your last visit to the health facility?
Counsel women about Implant is only effective for 5 year and after 5 year she should use new Implant to continue it
It has been more than 5 year you are using Implant

**Counseling:**
Lactational amenorrhea method or LAM will only be effective for family planning until your baby is 6 months old. It will be important to start another method at 6 months after your delivery. We have many other methods that are effective. It is important to start thinking and planning for other methods
Have you taken your pill everyday?
The pill is effective for family planning if you remember to take it everyday.
Please enter the date when you had this procedure done(female sterilize)
Please enter the date when you had this procedure done (implant)
Please enter the date when you had this procedure done(implant second)
Please enter the date when you had this procedure done (IUD)
Please enter the date when you had this procedure done(male sterilize)

Counsel: It appears that you were pregnant while using this method. You should visit a health facility to discuss changing your method or finding a more effective method.
Also, please inform your supervisor of the situation.
Number of years since you had this procedure:
Number of years since you had this procedure:
Number of years since your husband had this procedure:
Number of months since you had this procedure:
Number of years since you had this procedure:
Number of years since you had this procedure:
Wanted a more effective family planning method
Wanted to use a different family planning method
Don't like side effects/ Worried about health effects of Contraception
Why did you discontinue the family planning you were using last month?
What side effects are you concerned about?
No knowledge of where to Obtain method
Concerned about side effects or health effects of using Contraception
Sometimes it can be unpredictable when your husband may return. There are several effective methods that you can use even if your husband is away.
At the last home visit, you were not using any family planning method. Did you start a family planning method?
This is a less effective method for family planning. We have many other methods that are more effective.

Woman is in menopause if it has been more than 12 months since her last menstrual period. However, woman should not be classified as menopause if
* her age is less than 40 * or she is using any contraception with hormones such as Injectables or Implants, * or if she is within 2 years postpartum.
If the woman does not fall within any of the above criteria and still has not menstruated in the last 12 months or more then she is considered menopausal. If this is correct this person will be removed from the PSS workflow after submitting this form.

Are you currently doing something or using any method to delay or avoid getting pregnant?
HINT:
1) if more than one contraceptive, please choose ALL that apply
2) if husband is away but woman is still using contraceptive, please select contraceptive method regardless
3) For LAM, exclusive breastfeeding per WHO is giving the baby only breastmilk day and night, does not specify the number of times (not necessary to feed baby 10-12 times)

Female Sterilization does not protect against HIV or sexually transmitted infections. Condoms should still be used to prevent against HIV/sexually transmitted infections. If you experience irregular bleeding or abdominal pain or you think you might be pregnant, go visit the hospital because pregnancy after sterilization can be dangerous.
Male Sterilization does not protect against HIV or sexually transmitted infections. Condoms should still be used to prevent against HIV/sexually transmitted infections
Your method does not protect against HIV or sexually transmitted infections. Condoms should still be used to prevent against HIV/sexually transmitted infections.
Choose one method of entering LMP data.
When was your LMP ? (enter exact date)
How long ago was your LMP? (enter in weeks)
Do you know your LMP? (accurate within 1 week)
Have you had a period in the last 6 weeks?
Have you had regular period since your delivery or abortion?
Have you had sexual intercourse since your last delivery?
Have you had sexual intercourse since your last menstrual period?
Do you have symptoms of pregnancy?
Do not do a urine pregnancy test
Ran out of stock during field visit today.
Please refer this women to the hospital and check back in two weeks.
Please inform woman that she will be tested again in 2 weeks because the test was indeterminant.
Please inform woman that she will be tested again in 2 weks because the test was not functioning
Please inform the woman that she will be tested again in 2 weeks because she was not tested
Please do not forget to fill out the ANC register for this woman.
A woman who has missed her period for more than 6 weeks, and tests negative is a suspected case of pregnancy. Needs to be followed up in 2 weeks for confirmation.

"This woman's LMP is Unknown.
Its important to know how far your pregnancy is so please go to hospital for confirmation within 1 week."
Do you want to have more children in the future?
If this patient has died, her case will be closed and she will be removed from care delivery.
If this patient has permanently migrated, then she will be removed from care delivery forms
This woman's ID is: Her name is:
You are at the end of the Pregnancy Surveillance Form. Please save and close to proceed.
This woman should next be visited for PSS on:
This woman should next be visited for ANC on:
This woman should next be visited for PDF on:
Woman does not want our service
Husband has died and she does not need this service anymore
If no, please select a reason
Will be back anytime withing 6 months
Temporary Migration Gone for more than 6 months but less than a year
Don't know where this person has gone to.
Permanent Migration(gone for more than 1 year)
Please provide a reason for his/her absence.
*Her Delivery/abortion date is:** If it is not correct, you can go back and correct it. If correct, please continue ahead.
Date of Delivery/ Date of Abortion
She has been receiving PNC Counseling from me
She has had an abortion/miscarriage within the last 2 months but has not received PNC counseling from me.
She has delivered after more than 28 weeks of pregnancy within 1 year but has not received PNC counseling from me.

Please ask these questions below and select the answer that best describes the woman's current status:
1. Is this woman currently confirmed pregnant? 2. Is she receiving PNC counseling from you? 3. Has she delivered in the past one year? 4. Has she had an abortion in the past 2 months?
[HIDDEN] This woman's pregnancy status will be updated to be:
This woman will be removed from the eligible women group. Please save and close the form.
This woman will be updated as pregnant. She will be removed from eligible women and entered into the anc workflow. Please start ANC for this woman today.
This woman has a suspected pregnancy and will remain in the eligible woman workflow. She may have a due date for next visit which is sooner.
This woman is not pregnant. She will remain in the eligible woman workflow and does not need to be visited again for 3 months.
This woman does not need ANC counseling. She can go directly to the PNC counseling group. Please fill out her Post Delivery form and her PNC form today.
This woman is not pregnant. Please continue with her PNC balanced counseling every 3 months.
Is the woman available at home?
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist her if necessary and inform your supervisor.
Refer to the health post to examine breast pain.

"Counsel on postpartum mood changes:
Because of the hormone/chemical changes in your body after birth, it is very common to feel sad for no specific reason. These feelings will pass.If you are feeling so sad that you cannot care for your infant or you think about hurting yourself or someone else, it is very important to see a health worker. These may be signs of postpartum depression, which needs treatment with medication"
Please refer this woman to the hospital immediately. Assist her if necessary and inform your supervisor.
If yes, do you have fever or soft mass?
Have you had any feelings of hurting yourself, your baby, or someone else?
During your last visit, this woman was immediately referred to a health facility due to a danger sign. Did she visit the health facility?

bind.relevant: selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'emerg_contraceptive') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'fem_condom') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'condom') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'pills') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'injectables') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'implants') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'iud') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'male_sterilize') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'fem_sterilize') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_current , 'lact_amenorrhea')

bind.constraint: if( /pregnancy_screening_form/pnc1_ctx = 1, not((selected(., 'postpartum') or selected(., 'not_preg')) and count-selected(.) = 1), if( /pregnancy_screening_form/pnc1_ctx != 1, not(selected(., 'getting_pnc_care') and count-selected(.) = 1), count-selected(.) = 1))

bind.jr:constraintMsg: Date of delivery cannot be in the future or before one year ago or date of abortion cannot be before 2 months.

bind.constraint: not(selected(., 'no_sex') and selected(., 'infrequent_sex') and count-selected(.) >= 2) and if( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_contraceptive_last = 'lact_amenorrhea', not((selected(., 'costly') or selected(., 'lack_of_access')) and count-selected(.) >= 1), count-selected(.) = 1)
bind.jr:constraintMsg: Cannot select No sex and Infrequent Sex at the same time or select costly or lack of access if you were using LAM previously.
Cannot select No menses and Irregular menses at the same time
You cannot choose yes for this woman

bind.constraint: if(selected(., 'none'), count-selected(.) <= 1, if( /pregnancy_screening_form/pp_days > 180 or /pregnancy_screening_form/pp_days = '' or ( /pregnancy_screening_form/pp_days_ctx != '' and /pregnancy_screening_form/pp_days_ctx > 180) or /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_breast_feeding = 'no' or /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_return_menses = 'yes' or ( /pregnancy_screening_form/number_of_births = '1' and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status1 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth')) or ( /pregnancy_screening_form/number_of_births = '2' and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status1 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status2 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth')) or ( /pregnancy_screening_form/number_of_births = '3' and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status1 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status2 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status3 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome3 = 'still_birth')) or ( /pregnancy_screening_form/number_of_births = '4' and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status1 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome1 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status2 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome2 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status3 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome3 = 'still_birth') and ( /pregnancy_screening_form/child_status4 = 'dead' or /pregnancy_screening_form/birth_outcome4 = 'still_birth')), not(selected(., 'lact_amenorrhea') and count-selected(.) >= 1), count-selected(.) >= 1))

bind.relevant: selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year_hf_visit_change_remove_implant_5year_more , 'no') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year_hf_visit_change_remove_implant_5year_more , 'few_days_for_implant') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year_implant_second_questions , 'will_put_implant_in_next_visit') or selected( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_implant_more_than_5_year_implant_second_questions , 'no')

bind.jr:constraintMsg: This date cannot be in the future.
This date cannot be in the future.
This date cannot be in the future.
This date cannot be in the future.
This date cannot be in the future.

bind.calculate: if( /pregnancy_screening_form/iud_date = '', int((decimal-date-time(today()) - decimal-date-time( /pregnancy_screening_form/continue_pss/continue_pss_contraceptive_related/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_procedure_dates/continue_pss_contraceptive_related_procedure_dates_iud_date )) div 365.25), int((decimal-date-time(today()) - decimal-date-time( /pregnancy_screening_form/iud_date )) div 365.25))

select1.hint: Exclusive breastfeeding is when the infant receives only breast milk, without any additional food or drink (that includes animal milk), not even water.

Woman is in menopause if it has been more than 12 months since her last menstrual period. Woman should not be classified as menopause if her age is <40, or if she is using any contraception with hormones, or if she is within 2 years postpartum.

input.hint: It is okay to record an approximate date.
It is okay to record an approximate date.
It is okay to record an approximate date.
It is okay to record an approximate date.

select1.hint: A confirmed pregnancy is when woman has visited health post/ hospital and repeated UPT or done a USG.
Exclusive breastfeeding is when the infant receives only breast milk, without any additional food or drink (that includes animal milk), not even water.
If the answer is Yes for both, select Yes. Otherwise, select No.
